claim: Lung Cleaner Tritydo is an FDA-approved product that can manage asthma, treat bronchitis, pneumonia, COVID-19, and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease. It can also prevent lung cancer, and treat dry cough and sore throat, fluid buildup in the lungs, a collapsed lung, and shortness of breath.
review: VERA FILES FACT CHECK: More BOGUS ads on Lung Cleaner Tritydo circulate

claim: Moderna CEO Stéphane Bancel Admits Company Produced 100,000 COVID-19 Doses in 2019 Before The Pandemic Started.
review: Posts Misrepresent Moderna CEO’s Remarks on Vaccine Production

claim: Japan launches official investigation into Covid-19 vaccine deaths
review: Social media posts falsely claim Japan launches probe into 'millions' of Covid-19 vaccine deaths

claim: Three studies show “Covid-19 vaccines are harmful and ineffective”.
review: Two of the studies referenced show that, in certain scenarios, more vaccinated people were infected with Covid-19 than unvaccinated people, but this is not good evidence of vaccine ineffectiveness. None of them show the vaccines to be harmful.

claim: Moderna was already producing COVID-19 vaccines before the beginning of the pandemic

claim: Moderna CEO Admits That Company Produced COVID-19 Vaccines In 2019

claim: “PCR kits have never been about testing for COVID” [...] They’re cloning devices”
review: PCR-based COVID-19 tests aren’t cloning devices and don’t modify the human genome

claim: 19.2 million people declined the first Covid-19 vaccine in the UK.
review: This is an overestimate. It includes many children who were not offered the vaccine, and assumes a much higher UK population than exists in reality.

claim: CDC Dep. Dir. Tom Shimabukuro Admits COVID Vaccines Are Causing "Debilitating Illnesses"
review: Fact Check: CDC's Shimabukuro Did NOT Admit COVID Vaccines Are Causing 'Debilitating Illnesses'

claim: Moderna's CEO said the company produced 100,000 Covid-19 vaccines in 2019

claim: Georgia 'sudden cardiac arrest' form is new and tied to COVID-19 vaccine

claim: Price of Moderna and Pfizer COVID-19 vaccines will increase

claim: Damar Hamlin nearly died due to the COVID-19 vaccine

claim: Qantas boss Alan Joyce had a pie smeared in his face because of his support of COVID vaccine mandates.

claim: COVID-19 mRNA vaccines don't work and are causing serious harm, including death

claim: Studies show egg yolks significantly increase immunity against Covid-19.
review: Researchers have found that inoculating chickens leads to Covid antibodies in their egg yolks. This doesn’t mean normal eggs have an anti-Covid effect when eaten, and we have no evidence that these antibodies can be used clinically.

claim: Joe Biden closed schools during the COVID-19 pandemic.

claim: Data show increase in cancer cases in South Korea after Covid vaccination

claim: Hunter Brown's death caused by the COVID-19 vaccine
review: Fact check: No link between Air Force cadet's death, COVID-19 vaccine

claim: The Covid-19 vaccine caused Claire Bridges to lose both her legs.
review: This is not true. Claire Bridges’ legs had to be amputated because of complications from a Covid-19 infection, combined with her longstanding heart condition. She has confirmed that the vaccine had nothing to do with it.

claim: 18 million Americans have been left seriously injured by Covid-19 vaccinations.
review: An estimated 18 million Americans vaccinated against Covid-19 sought medical attention at some point after being vaccinated. That estimate is itself uncertain, and even if accurate, would not show that all those cases were caused by the vaccine.

claim: Government, Pfizer documents confirm COVID-19 vaccines have led to millions of deaths as a result of recipients developing vaccine-associated enhanced disease (VAED).

claim: Installing defibrillators in all schools is proof that Covid-19 vaccines are not safe.

claim: The U.S. government says 5G causes COVID-19

claim: New studies show bivalent COVID-19 boosters have zero efficacy.
review: False. The studies showed the bivalent boosters are effective, just not substantially more so than the original vaccine.

claim: More than 1500 athletes have suffered cardiac arrest since COVID vaccinations began, compared to a previous average of 29 per year.

claim: By 29 September last year, at least 47 people in NI had died from “vaccine injury”.
review: This claim misrepresents data from the Yellow Card reporting system for suspected adverse reactions to Covid-19 vaccines. A Yellow Card report about a fatal outcome is NOT the same as a death where vaccines have been confirmed as a factor. However, a closer look at official figures reveals how confusing and incomplete publicly-available information can be

claim: A video circulates with the claim that World Doctors Union recently held a conference on the COVID-19 pandemic.

claim: The mRNA Covid-19 vaccines are gene therapy.

claim: The claim that the daily rate of vaccine deaths is now higher than Covid deaths has been discussed in the House of Commons.
review: The document being used to evidence this is written evidence submitted to a select committee, not a quote from the House of Commons. Anyone can submit written evidence. The claim that daily vaccine deaths have overtaken Covid-19 deaths is based on Yellow Card reporting, which is misleading as Yellow Card reports are not evidence of proven side effects.

A graph showing Swiss COVID-19 mortality proves hydroxychloroquine is an effective treatment for the virus.
review: False. The data used does not match official figures. Additionally, experts say the selective analysis of the data cannot be used to draw conclusions about the drug.

claim: It’s called the Delta Covid-19 variant because you’d have to be completely asleep to believe it.
review: Like other viruses, the one that causes Covid-19 has variants, which are named after Greek letters. Types of brain waves are also named this way, which is why there is a delta wave that occurs when people are sleeping. There’s plenty of evidence that the Delta variant is real, including the fact that it’s been sequenced multiple times, has infected and killed people.

claim: More than 80 Canadian doctors have dropped dead after receiving their fourth mandated COVID-19 vaccine.
review: False. Many died of causes unrelated to the vaccine. There is no evidence to suggest the others died as a result of immunisation.

claim: Economic inactivity is up by half a million since the spring of 2019 largely because of long Covid.
review: Economic inactivity because of long-term sickness has risen by about half a million in that time. But some of that rise predates the pandemic and data from the Office for National Statistics and independent analysis suggests much of it is due to factors other than long Covid.

claim: Increases in respiratory syncytial virus in children are linked to the COVID-19 vaccine.

claim: Pfizer vaccine trials showed a 95% relative risk reduction in the development of infection against the ancestral, more lethal strain of the virus. However, the absolute risk reduction for an individual was only 0.84%.
review: These figures are correct, but relative risk reduction is most commonly used to communicate vaccine effectiveness as the way in which it is calculated means it is relevant no matter how prevalent Covid-19 is in the community. Absolute risk reduction is sensitive to the prevalence of the virus, so the figure measured during the trials may be less relevant to real-world situations.

claim: The mRNA vaccines are not safe and not effective.
review: The vaccines used in the UK have all met the MHRA’s standards for safety and effectiveness, and it says the number of Yellow Card reports received so far is not beyond what was expected. Vaccine effectiveness has changed over the course of the pandemic, but they are still effective against hospitalisation and death.

claim: Serious adverse effects reported by the public after vaccination are thought to represent only 10% of the true rate of serious adverse events.
review: The Medicines and Healthcare products Regulatory Agency (MHRA) has specifically warned this estimate shouldn’t be used for Covid-19 vaccines, given there was high public awareness of its Yellow Card scheme.

claim: “Evidence Suggests the COVID Shots Are Responsible for Soaring RSV Cases Throughout the U.S. & Canada.”

claim: Pfizer signed a confidential agreement with the Australian government which means the ingredients of the COVID-19 vaccine are kept a secret.
review: False. The vaccine ingredients are publicly available, as required by Australian law.

claim: Death of 4 years old poster boy for vaccination campaign is linked to COVID-19 vaccine

claim: The mRNA vaccines are experimental.
review: mRNA technology has been researched for a number of years, and the vaccines have been tested to high standards for safety and effectiveness, in the same way as other vaccines.

claim: mRNA vaccines are not recommended for pregnant women or those who are breastfeeding.
review: False. Both the Pfizer and Moderna Covid-19 vaccines are recommended by public health bodies for those who are pregnant or breastfeeding.

claim: There have been more reported deaths and adverse reactions following mRNA vaccination in 18 months than there has been to every conventional vaccine administered worldwide for the last 50 years.
review: While the source for this is unclear, data from the US Centres for Disease Control suggests this is plausible, when looking at reports of adverse events. However, these reported events were not necessarily caused by vaccination.

claim: President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. says he has instructed his Cabinet secretaries to continue giving cash assistance and subsidies to poor Filipinos amid the COVID-19 pandemic until the government feels the people could already stand on their own feet.

claim: The government issued contradictory evidence on Covid-19 vaccination in pregnancy, from advising pregnant women to get vaccinated to then not recommending it
review: This appears to refer to confusion when a government document published in December 2020, and not recommending vaccination of pregnant women appeared as if it was updated in August 2022. In fact vaccination against Covid-19 has been recommended for pregnant women since April 2021.

claim: The U.K. Medicines and Healthcare products Regulatory Agency (MHRA) admits in a series of email exchanges that COVID-19 is man-made and that COVID vaccines were created with computer-generated DNA.
review: Fact Check: UK Medicines Regulator Does NOT Confirm COVID Is Man-Made; Vaccines Were NOT Made With Computer-Generated DNA

claim: Coroners up and down the country have found in their reports that deaths have been caused directly by Covid-19 vaccines.
review: This is true. There were 47 such deaths in England and none in Wales up to September 2022. In Scotland over the same period there have been nine. There has been one registered death in Northern Ireland up to the end of March 2022.

claim: Post implies DJ Mighty Mouse died of heart condition from COVID-19 vaccine

claim: A study published in The Journal of the American Medical Association showed that one in 500 children under five years of age who received a Pfizer Covid vaccine were hospitalised with a vaccine injury, and one in 200 had symptoms ongoing for weeks or months afterwards.”
review: It is misleading to call these “vaccine injuries”. The study in question was looking at events that occurred after vaccination, but were not necessarily related to or caused by the vaccine.

claim: COVID-19 Vaccine Stillbirths Increase Graph

claim: There are an estimated 1,500 cases of myocarditis per million patients with Covid—far greater than the risk of myocarditis following vaccination.
review: This statistic is based on a US study published in September 2021, which looked at the association between Covid-19 and myocarditis between March 2020 and January 2021. The dominant variant of Covid-19 has now changed, with some indication that Omicron is a milder disease, so it is not clear that this rate is still relevant.

claim: All staff at St Thomas’ Hospital were required to sign the Official Secrets Act when Boris Johnson was admitted with Covid-19. Two doctors who disagreed with his diagnosis refused, and were sent home 'on leave'.
review: This is not true. It comes from an invented article labelled as “satire”.

claim: Pfizer Covid vaccine cause mass depopulation through infertility
In a June 2022 dissenting opinion, U.S. Supreme Court Justice Clarence Thomas asserted a debunked claim about the use of aborted fetal cells in COVID-19 vaccines.
review: Did Clarence Thomas Claim Vaccines Contain Cells of Aborted Fetuses?

claim: Pfizer and Moderna mRNA COVID-19 vaccines are associated with an increased risk of serious adverse events of special interest.
review: Fact Check: Moderna, Pfizer Vaccines Do NOT Show Increased Risk Of Serious Adverse Events Of Special Interest In Randomized Trials

claim: “Covid Vaccines More Likely to Put You in Hospital Than Keep You Out”
review: Studies show that the benefits of COVID-19 vaccines outweigh their risks; preprint claiming to show otherwise is flawed

claim: A new study and Pfizer documents prove COVID-19 vaccination will cause mass depopulation through infertility and premature death.
review: Fact Check: New Study, Pfizer Docs Do NOT Prove COVID-19 Vaccination Will Cause Mass Depopulation Through Infertility, Death

claim: Banks in Shanghai stopped ATM operations due to the fear of contaminated banknotes spreading COVID-19.
review: Misleading. Banking services in Shanghai were suspended during the lockdown from mid-March to the end of May 2022. In June they were fully in operation.

claim: Pfizer’s mRNA Covid-19 vaccine temporarily impairs semen concentration and total motile count amongst donors which is evidence it was part of a plan to depopulate the world.
review: A paper looking at 37 sperm donors did find these markers were temporarily reduced. There’s no evidence that the vaccine has any lasting effect on fertility or is evidence of a depopulation plan.

claim: "mRNA Vaccine Exposed! Bayer Admits COVID-19 Vaccine is Gene Therapy."
review: Website Peddles Old, Debunked Falsehood About COVID-19 mRNA Vaccines

claim: If you got the Covid-19 vaccine you probably won’t be able to get pregnant.
review: There is no evidence this is the case. There is no evidence or theoretically plausible reason why having the vaccine can stop you getting pregnant.

claim: Deaths from Covid-19 vaccines are being miscategorised as deaths from “Sudden Adult Death Syndrome”.
review: There is no evidence for this. The designation of SADS significantly predates the pandemic.

claim: Covid-19 vaccines during pregnancy caused "baby die-off"
review: US author Naomi Wolf falsely claims Covid-19 vaccinated mothers caused 'baby die-off'

claim: COVID Shots Do INCREASE Risk Of Infection.
review: Fact Check: 'Official Study' Does NOT Confirm COVID Shots 'INCREASE Risk Of Infection' -- 'Vaccines Protect'

claim: SADS is an adverse effect of the Covid-19 vaccine
review: Covid-19 vaccines not linked to Sudden Arrhythmic Death Syndromes

claim: “Hailey Bieber had a blood clot in her brain. Justin Bieber now has Ramsey Hunt Syndrome." Claims both conditions “have been linked” to COVID-19 vaccination.
review: Social Media Swirls With Unsupported Claims About Cause of Justin and Hailey Bieber’s Medical Conditions

claim: Bayer Admits Covid 10 Vaccine Is Gene Therapy
review: Fact Check: Bayer Top Exec Did NOT Admit COVID-19 Vaccine Is Gene Therapy

claim: COVID vaccine lowers sperm count
Bill Gates COVID 19 Vaccine Breast Milk Baby Formula Shortage
review: Fact Check: COVID-19 Vaccines Do NOT Reduce Breast Milk Supplies Long Term, Didn't Cause Baby Formula Shortage And Bill Gates Is NOT Behind It All

claim: Throughout Europe, the USA, the UK and Australia, medicine regulators have received reports of 77,068 deaths due to Covid-19 vaccination.
review: Incorrect. These are reports of deaths following vaccination, not necessarily because of it. Regulators for all four regions warn users not to misinterpret their data in this way.

claim: Justin Bieber linked his facial paralysis to the Covid-19 vaccine
review: Article falsely claims Justin Bieber linked facial paralysis to vaccine

claim: Pfizer does not produce the Comirnaty vaccine, which is different from Pfizer’s COVID-19 vaccine that the public uses.
review: FALSE: Pfizer does not produce the Comirnaty vaccine

claim: Ramsay Hunt syndrome that caused Justin Bieber’s facial paralysis is linked to the COVID-19 vaccine
review: Justin Bieber’s facial paralysis is caused by a viral infection; no evidence that COVID-19 vaccine played a role

claim: Justin Bieber Said That COVID-19 Vax Ruined His Life
review: Fact Check: Justin Bieber Did NOT Say That COVID-19 Vaccine Ruined His Life

claim: "Young people are dropping dead" from Sudden Arrhythmic Death Syndrome, or SADS, after COVID-19 vaccines were introduced.
review: Posts Baselessly Link Sudden Arrhythmic Death Syndrome to COVID-19 Vaccines

claim: Pfizer’s COVID-19 vaccine is not safe for pregnant women despite what the pharmaceutical company says, according to a lab study performed on 42 rats and their babies.
review: Misleading. No causal association was found between vaccination and birth defects in rats. Medical authorities and experts around the world say the vaccine is safe for pregnant individuals at any stage.

claim: "New Peer-Reviewed Study: COVID-19 Vaccines Increase Risk of Cardiac Arrest in Young People by 25 Percent."
review: Posts Distort Questionable Study on COVID-19 Vaccination and EMS Calls

claim: COVID-19 vaccination is associated with the sudden death of young adults
review: SADS is caused by genetic mutations affecting the electrical system regulating heartbeat; no evidence it is caused by COVID-19 vaccines

claim: The US National Institutes of Health’s own website states that Covid-19 was a planned and orchestrated scam-demic.
review: No it doesn’t. This was written in an opinion piece that can be found by searching PubMed, a database maintained by the NIH. It was not published by, or funded by the NIH.

claim: “Countries with high levels of mask compliance did not perform better than those with low mask usage”; “Mask Mandates [are] Associated With Increased Covid Death Rate”
review: Scientific evidence shows that mask-wearing is effective at limiting community transmission; claims that face masks increase mortality are based on flawed correlation studies

claim: "New Data from Walgreens Reveals Unvaccinated Have the Lowest Positivity Rate for COVID. ... Obviously, the vaccines are not working as advertised."

claim: Monkeypox is a side effect of Pfizer's Covid-19 vaccine
review: Monkeypox not a side effect of Pfizer's Covid-19 vaccine

claim: A NSW ‘teacher shortage’ is being fuelled by 13,699 staff who can’t enter the classroom because of inadequate COVID-19 vaccination statuses.
review: Misleading. The figure mostly consists of inactive teachers who haven't updated and aren’t required to update their vaccination status. Almost 95 per cent of active NSW teachers are vaccinated.

claim: Ray Liotta died because of the COVID-19 vaccine.
review: PolitiFact | No, Ray Liotta didn’t die from the COVID-19 vaccine

claim: purportedly shows a tweet from Republican Kentucky Sen. Rand Paul in which he claims to have evidence that COVID-19 vaccines are "harming and killing people."
review: FACT CHECK: Did Rand Paul Tweet He Had Evidence COVID-19 Vaccines Kill People?

claim: Babies of vaccinated mothers are dying in disproportionate numbers and the COVID-19 vaccines are responsible
review: Large-scale studies have found that COVID-19 vaccination doesn’t increase the risk of negative pregnancy outcomes, contrary to claim by Naomi Wolf

claim: WHO approved substances to prevent long Covid symptoms
review: WHO did not approve Thai food supplement to 'prevent long Covid'

claim: Global News article said Pfizer Covid-19 vaccine has a 12% efficacy rate

claim: purportedly shows an article from Global News claiming that data from the pharmaceutical company Pfizer indicates its COVID-19 vaccine has a 12 percent efficacy rate.
review: FACT CHECK: Did Global News Report That Pfizer’s COVID-19 Vaccine Has A 12 Percent Efficacy Rate?

review: Fact Check: National Institutes Of Health Study Does NOT Find Long COVID Isn't Real

claim: FDA had Data Showing 82% – 97% of Pregnant Women Injected with the Pfizer COVID-19 Vaccine Lost Their Babies Before Approving the Shots
review: Fact Check: Pfizer Vaccine Data Given To FDA Does NOT Show Up To 97% Of Vaccinated Pregnant Women Lost Their Babies

claim: Photos show mouldy products after Shanghai Covid lockdown in 2022
review: Damaged goods found at department store in Malaysia in 2020, not Shanghai in 2022

claim: Chimp adenovirus in AstraZeneca's Covid-19 vaccine causes monkeypox
review: Posts misleadingly link AstraZeneca Covid jab to monkeypox cases

claim: Covid-19 vaccines cause a form of AIDS which is causing people to exhibit symptomatic herpes.
review: There is no evidence Covid-19 vaccines cause autoimmune disorders. However, there is some evidence, albeit unclear, that vaccines may trigger reactivation of existing shingles infections, which is caused by a virus from the herpes viral family.

claim: 13,783 cases of shingles, one of the adverse reactions of the Covid vaccines, are reported on the Vaccine Adverse Event Reporting System.
review: Around 13,000 cases of shingles have been reported on VAERS, but that doesn’t mean the vaccine caused them.

claim: Monkeypox is linked to the chimpanzee virus used in the AstraZeneca Covid-19 vaccine
review: Although the vaccine contains a modified virus that usually infects chimpanzees, this cannot lead to monkeypox or any other disease in humans.

claim: The Covid-19 vaccines have killed two people for every one life saved.
review: A major study has found no link between receiving two Covid-19 vaccinations and the number of deaths reported after vaccination in the US. Estimates suggest the vaccines averted over 1 million Covid-19 deaths in America and 157,000 in England by November 2021.

claim: Pfizer's CEO says that the company's COVID-19 treatment pill will contain a microchip that transmits information once swallowed
review: Fact Check: Did Pfizer CEO Say That Their COVID-19 Treatment Pill Will Have Microchip? Here’s The Truth

claim: The FDA said heart attacks following the Covid-19 vaccines are 71 times higher than following other vaccines.
review: This claim was not made by the FDA, but by a member of the public during an FDA open meeting. There is no known link between the Covid-19 vaccines and heart attacks.

claim: Video shows children going to school during Shanghai's Covid lockdown
review: Video shows children wearing hazmat suits in northern China, not 'Shanghai during lockdown'

claim: The US military has found pesticides in Moderna’s Covid-19 vaccines.
review: This claim is false and originates from a story on a website which states it posts satirical content.

claim: Monkeypox is a side effect of the Covid-19 vaccines.
review: There is no evidence this is true. Monkeypox is caused by a virus.

claim: Monkeypox is caused by COVID-19 vaccines; a 2021 tabletop exercise portraying a monkeypox pandemic is evidence that global leaders planned the outbreak; the monkeypox vaccine was “ready” before the outbreak
review: Monkeypox outbreak triggers conspiracy theories on social media claiming that it was planned or incorrectly linking it to COVID-19 vaccines

claim: The government is providing ₹ 5,000 COVID-19 relief fund to each citizen
review: 403 Forbidden

claim: Data From England DOES Show Children Are Up To 303 Times More Likely To Die From COVID Following Vaccination Than Unvaccinated Children.
review: Fact Check: Data DOES Show British Children Up To 303 Times More Likely To Die From COVID After Vaccination Than Unvaccinated Kids -- But Sickest Got Shots First

claim: Rapper Dr. Creep Predicted The 2020 COVID-19 Pandemic In A 2013 Song
review: Fact Check: Rapper Dr. Creep Did NOT Predict The 2020 COVID-19 Pandemic In A 2013 Song

claim: Masks and vaccines don't work because, despite a very high rate of mask use and vaccination, Hong Kong recorded among the highest number of confirmed COVID-19 cases and mortality rate in the world during the fifth wave.
review: Misleading. Many of the infections during the fifth wave took place under the circumstances where citizens did not wear masks. The vaccination rate of elderly citizens and care home residents remained low until these groups were hit the hardest in the fifth wave.

claim: A study shows COVID-19 vaccines increase the risk of cardiac arrest in young people by 25 per cent.
review: False. The study’s authors and other experts say the study does not establish any causal link. They say statistical and methodological weaknesses make it hard to infer much from the results.

claim: Russian, Spanish airlines are telling COVID-19 vaccinated people to not fly
review: Airlines in Spain and Russia have not 'warned Covid vaccinated people not to fly'

claim: COVID-19 Vaccines Do Cause Monkeypox, Shingles.

claim: Pfizer document reveal dangers associated with Covid vaccine
Event 201 is evidence that officials already knew about COVID-19
review: Event 201 isn’t evidence that authorities knew or planned the COVID-19 pandemic

claim: "it is good to see that we have now got employment at an even higher rate than pre-Covid."
review: Fact check: UK Government claim about employment levels is false

claim: Pfizer's CEO said a fourth covid vaccine dose is necessary
review: 403 Forbidden

claim: Liberal, Labor and Greens plan to make Covid-19 vaccination mandatory

review: PolitiFact | Fake tweets make claims about ivermectin studies that don’t exist

claim: “they were not able to find a single healthy child in america that died from COVID-19 […] but one in every 2700 people are getting myocarditis”; “athletes are collapsing on playing fields as for myocarditis and it's from the vaccines”; Moderna patent filed in 2019 is linked to the pandemic
review: The benefits of COVID-19 vaccines in preventing severe disease and other complications outweigh the risk of myocarditis, which is higher after COVID-19 itself

claim: purportedly shows a Fox News tweet about new studies that show "68% of those who used ivermectin to treat or prevent Covid are suffering long-term bowel and urinary incontinence."
review: FACT CHECK: Did Fox News Tweet About Studies That Link Ivermectin To Incontinence?

claim: Philippine capital placed under heightened Covid restriction after elections
review: Posts share false Covid lockdown notice for Manila after Philippine elections

claim: New documents reveal that Pfizer’s Covid-19 vaccine has just 12% efficacy.
review: This appears to be based on a misinterpretation of a document showing results from a clinical trial first published in 2020. The clinical trial showed the vaccine’s efficacy rate was 95% from seven days after the second dose, although the latest data relating to the Omicron variant does show lower efficacy which reduces significantly over time.

claim: Pfizer did not recommend its Covid-19 vaccine for pregnant or breastfeeding women.
review: Evidence from studies conducted during the vaccine rollout show the vaccine to be safe for use during pregnancy and breastfeeding.

claim: U.S. Military Finds Pesticides In Moderna COVID-19 Vaccines

claim: More people are in work than before the Covid-19 pandemic.

claim: "Just released” Pfizer documents show the Pfizer COVID-19 vaccine is “12% effective.”

claim: Pfizer released list of worrying side effects to the Covid-19 vaccine

claim: Mandatory Covid-19 vaccinations have just been passed “under the radar” by the European Council.
review: This is based on a misreading of a resolution passed by a completely different organisation. The resolution explicitly states citizens should be informed that vaccines aren’t mandatory.

claim: The U.S. military subjected vials of Moderna's COVID-19 vaccine to chemical analysis and found that some contained toxic pesticides.
review: No, Military Didn't Find Pesticides in Moderna Vaccines

claim: "When President Biden took office ... there was no [COVID-19] vaccine available."

claim: Denmark has stopped their entire COViD vaccination program.
review: Fact Check: Denmark Covid programme halted, not stopped, viral post is misleading

claim: A Nigeria Centre for Disease Control study shows that over 50% of Nigerians have been exposed to the virus, and have antibodies for Covid-19.
review: Do more than half of Nigerians have Covid-19 antibodies, as newspaper claimed? Study didn’t quite say that

claim: Official Study Does Conclude That Masks Caused More COVID
review: Fact Check: 'Official Study' Is NOT Official, Does NOT Conclude That Masks Caused More COVID

claim: Pfizer documents say covid vaccine hurts fetus
Pfizer Covid-19 vaccine is not safe for pregnant women
review: Posts falsely claim Pfizer Covid-19 vaccine dangerous during pregnancy

claim: Higher inflation is due to the COVID-19 pandemic and Russian President Vladimir Putin; "it's not because of spending.”

claim: Australia’s 2021 official death statistics provide evidence COVID-19 vaccines have caused thousands of excess deaths.
review: False. Experts say the excess deaths are around a one per cent increase and can be explained by various factors including delayed health treatments during the pandemic, an ageing population and low death rates in 2020.

claim: Covid-19 vaccines’ effectiveness dropped from 98% to just 1% among a wider, younger population. This information appeared in the Lancet medical journal.
review: The Pfizer and Moderna vaccines both reported over 90% effectiveness in trials. A subsequent Lancet article argued these relative risk reduction figures should be published alongside absolute risk reduction figures, a totally different measurement which the article said were around 1 to 2 percentage points for the vaccines. The latest data relating to the Omicron variant does show vaccine effectiveness reduces significantly over time however.

claim: Israel saw increased covid-related emergency cardiovascular events
A new Pfizer document shows the company admitting its Covid-19 vaccine is not safe for use in pregnancy or breastfeeding.
review: This is not a Pfizer document, nor is it new. It was published by the UK government in December 2020. Evidence from studies conducted during the vaccine rollout show the vaccine to be safe for use during pregnancy and breastfeeding.

claim: Two days before the elections, the Department of Health will report a surge in COVID-19 cases and attribute it to Leni Robredo's campaign rallies
review: VERA FILES FACT CHECK: Posts claiming DOH to bloat COVID cases before elections NOT TRUE

review: Fact Check: CDC Study Does NOT Find COVID-19 Vaccination Increases Risk Of Autoimmune Disease Myocarditis By 13,200%

claim: COVID-19 is a synthetic version of “snake venom” that evil forces are spreading through remdesivir, the COVID-19 vaccines and drinking water to “make you a hybrid of Satan.”

claim: An American Medical Association document confirms Pfizer's COVID-19 vaccine ingredients and effects vary depending on their "batch".

claim: Deaths Of More Than 4,000 Babies Due To COVID Shots are Found In US Vaccine Adverse Event Reporting System Data
review: Fact Check: Claim Of More Than 4,000 Fetal Or New-Born Deaths Due To COVID Shots NOT Found In US VAERS Data

claim: Obesity is more a determinant of how you're going to handle Covid than anything.
review: Studies have shown that weight is an important underlying risk factor for serious Covid-19 infections. However, age is the biggest predictive factor for serious illness.

claim: High Vaccination Rate does not Explain Why 92% Of English COVID Deaths Are Among Fully Vaccinated

claim: Covid-19 didn’t cause excess mortality, but there has been a huge uptick in the number of deaths in the middle aged and young since the start of the vaccine rollout.
review: Covid-19 caused a huge spike in excess mortality in England and Wales, with almost 98,000 excess deaths recorded between January 2020 and July 2021. Between the start of the vaccine roll-out and the end of 2021, deaths due to causes other than Covid-19 were above the five-year average. There is no evidence this was directly caused by the Covid-19 vaccine.

claim: The Australian economy is performing better than that of any other country after COVID-19.

claim: The COVID-19 vaccines contain “HIV lipid wrappers.”

claim: Covid-19 vaccine causes aphasia
COVID-19 vaccination has no benefits for children.

claim: Moderna created the coronavirus and inserted HIV into it.

claim: Official data has confirmed 800 COVID-19 'vaccine deaths' in Australia.

claim: Fifteen tennis players withdrew or retired from the Miami Open after suffering adverse effects of the COVID-19 vaccine.

claim: If you’ve had two doses of the COVID-19 vaccine and you haven’t had a booster jab, then you have a 50/50 chance of ending up in hospital if you catch Omicron.
review: CLAIM: If you’ve had two doses of the COVID-19 vaccine and you haven’t had a booster jab, then you have a 50/50 chance of ending up in hospital if you catch Omicron. CONCLUSION: INACCURATE (“Accurate” in a previous version of this article - see note below) based on a misinterpretation of data. Data published by the UK Health Security Agency at the time of the claim suggested that with two doses, vaccine effectiveness against hospitalisation due to Omicron was 52%. However, vaccine effectiveness against hospitalisation is not a measure of hospitalisation rates, it is a measure of how much vaccination reduces the chance that someone will need hospital, compared with having taken no vaccine at all. The data at the time said that, if you’ve had two vaccine doses but no booster, you would be 52% less likely to require hospital due to Omicron compared with if you caught that variant and were unvaccinated.

claim: COVID-19 vaccines can cause the generation of new variants.

However, this does not affect the more accurate measure of the death toll during the pandemic, which is based on death certificates.

review: This is not true. Receiving a Covid-19 vaccine makes you much less likely to be admitted to hospital with the disease.

claim: An Israeli study showed that vaccinated people were 27 times more likely to catch Covid-19 than unvaccinated people.
review: This is very misleading. The study compared vaccinated people with unvaccinated people who had been previously infected. It did not show that vaccinated people were more likely to catch Covid-19 than unvaccinated people in general.

claim: Genuine Covid-19 'vaccination exemption' cards in the Philippines
review: Fake 'vaccine exemption cards' in the Philippines tout Covid misinformation

claim: The Covid-19 vaccines are not safe because people are dying and getting seriously ill as a result of receiving them.
review: This is not true. Although there have been some extremely rare cases of death or serious illness caused by the Covid-19 vaccines, it is much safer to be vaccinated.

claim: Did Department of Defense 'whistleblowers' reveal 'mind-blowing COVID-19 vaccine injury numbers'?
review: Did Department of Defense 'whistleblowers' reveal 'mind-blowing COVID-19 vaccine injury numbers'?

claim: The CDC said that immunity from a prior Covid-19 infection is “paramount”.
review: This is not what the CDC said. It recommends vaccination against Covid-19.

claim: UKHSA data shows that people who receive a booster dose of the Covid-19 vaccine are more likely to be infected with the disease.
review: This is not true. The UKHSA data does not show this. Indeed the UKHSA warns against misinterpreting its data in this way.

claim: A video shared on Facebook claims Western Australia Premier Mark McGowan faked receiving his COVID-19 booster shot.

claim: The UK has recorded five times more deaths “due to” the Covid-19 vaccines than all other vaccines over the past five years
review: These refer to the number of deaths reported after vaccination though may not have been due to vaccination.

claim: Covid-19 vaccination has resulted in “catastrophic death and injury figures”.
review: With 52 million people currently vaccinated in the UK, there have been 439,578 reports of adverse reactions and 1,972 reports of death following vaccination. However, these reports are not evidence vaccines caused those reactions or deaths. All Covid-19 vaccines are licensed as safe for use in the UK and continuously monitored.

claim: A new Commission on Audit report questioned the validity of P479-million worth of COVID-19 relief goods that the Quezon City government procured in 2020.

claim: A French rugby player's death is connected to the COVID-19 vaccine
review: Fact check: French rugby player Jordan Michallet died by suicide, not COVID-19 vaccine

claim: Covid-19 vaccines can change your DNA.
review: This is not true. mRNA vaccines do not alter DNA.

claim: The police have the evidence and authority under the Criminal Law Act 1967 to confiscate Covid-19 vaccines.
review: Police have some powers to close public premises but there is almost no likelihood they would close down a Covid-19 vaccine facility, particularly if there is no evidence those facilities are involved in the perpetration of crime.

claim: The International Criminal Court in The Hague has acknowledged documents associated with a campaign to end the Covid-19 vaccine rollout.
review: This is true, but this is only a standard acknowledgement of a complaint and not proof of an investigation or wrongdoing.

claim: COVID-19 pneumonia is an allergic reaction
review: Fact check: Experts debunk claim that COVID-19 pneumonia is an allergic reaction

claim: An average of almost 5,000 Australians have been hospitalised with COVID-19 each day since the start of 2022.
review: False. Around 3,600 people on average were in hospital with COVID-19 each day from January 1 to January 20, the date of the claim.

claim: There is a live criminal investigation into the Covid-19 vaccine programme.
review: There isn’t. A crime reference number was created after campaigners visited a London police station in December 2021. The Metropolitan Police has confirmed there is no investigation.

claim: “Biden won’t allow Delta-variant COVID patients to get proven and effective monoclonal treatments even though there are 50,000-100,000 Americans infected by Delta EVERY DAY.”

claim: Only 17,500 people have died of Covid in England and Wales.
review: Incorrect. The true number is more than 140,000. 17,500 is roughly how many of these people did not have other pre-existing conditions.

claim: The Covid-19 vaccine might kill children who receive it.
review: This is not impossible, but the risk appears to be extremely small. We can find no evidence of a child dying as a result of a Covid-19 vaccine in the UK.

claim: Pfizer has changed the formulation of its Covid-19 vaccine for children aged five to 11 to include an ingredient used to stabilise heart attack patients.
review: The FDA recently approved the inclusion of tromethamine in paediatric doses of Pfizer’s Covid-19 vaccine. It was included to extend the vaccine’s shelf life, and is not currently used in the UK. It is used to treat a condition which may result from illness following a heart attack.

review: This isn’t true. The MHRA says there is no sign to suggest the vaccines are causing miscarriages, and the NHS says there is no need to avoid getting pregnant after having the vaccines.

claim: Figures from the Office for National Statistics say you’re 32,000 times more likely to die of Covid if you’ve not been double jabbed.
review:
The ONS report actually said that the age-adjusted risk of deaths involving Covid-19 was 32 times greater in unvaccinated people than in fully vaccinated individuals—not 32,000. 


In addition, the ONS and OSR have been clear that the 32 times greater figure changes over time due to a number of different factors, and this figure should not be used to measure vaccine effectiveness. 


The Jeremy Vine show has since tweeted to say that the statement was incorrect.

claim: An Israeli study found that natural immunity was better at protecting people from Covid-19 than the vaccine.
review: An Israeli research paper did find that immunity from prior infection may be more effective at protecting a patient from Covid-19 than vaccination. However, the study also found that a combination of natural immunity and vaccine-induced immunity was even more effective.

claim: “Real scientists” are trying to stop the rollout of the Covid-19 vaccines.
review: It is true that several scientists have argued that the vaccine rollout should be halted. However, their claims have been widely fact checked during the pandemic, and have been associated with dangerous misinformation about Covid-19 and vaccines.

claim: Pfizer Vaccine Will Kill 117 Kids To Save 1 Child From Dying Of COVID In 5 To 11 Age Group
review: Fact Check: Pfizer Vaccine Will NOT Kill 117 Kids To Save 1 Child From Dying Of COVID In 5 To 11 Age Group

claim: Mask-wearing cuts Covid incidence by 53%, says global study.
review: This isn’t what the study says. The study says that mask-wearing was “associated with” a reduction in risk, but that, due to the limitations of the research, “it was difficult for our review to draw a one directional or causal conclusion.”

claim: Australia's COVID-19 case fatality rate (CFR) is around one per cent or less for every age group.
review: Misleading. While the CFR is around one per cent for all COVID-19 cases in Australia, for older age groups it is as high as 32 per cent.

The MHRA also says deaths after Covid vaccines cannot be reliably compared with deaths after other vaccines, as there may be differences in reporting.

claim: There have been 1,517 deaths and 1,102,228 adverse reactions caused by the Covid-19 vaccines.
review:
These figures relate to Yellow Card reports. This is a mechanism to allow individuals to report any suspected reactions or side effects even if the reporter isn’t sure that it was caused by the vaccine. 

The MHRA says “It is very important to note that a Yellow Card report does not necessarily mean the vaccine caused that reaction or event”.

claim: purportedly shows a chart of planned variants of COVID-19 and when they will be allegedly "released" to the media

claim: The Australian government has admitted Covid-19 vaccines are a poison.
review: Under Western Australian legislation, vaccines (alongside medicines such as paracetamol) are classed as poisons. This is just a legal definition, and does not mean the government is saying they are dangerous or planning to poison people.

claim: Covid-19 trial participants who received the placebo will be considered as vaccinated.

In many cases, including the Novavax trial, participants who initially received the placebo will later be offered a vaccine. After the trial, participants have 16 weeks to get an NHS standard vaccine if they have not already received an appropriate one in their trial.

claim: The CDC is removing its request for emergency use authorisation of PCR tests. This is evidence that PCR tests don’t work, are fraudulent and cannot distinguish between influenza and Covid-19.
review: The CDC has given laboratories advance warning that they will stop requesting approval for one type of PCR test. This is because there are now other, more efficient PCR tests available. Some of these can simultaneously test for influenza viruses as well as SARS-CoV-2 to avoid having to take multiple samples or run multiple tests on the same sample if it is negative for SARS-CoV-2.

claim: TfL is part of a pilot whereby staff required to self-isolate can instead take daily Covid-19 tests at work.

claim: People who die of Covid would probably have died within a year.

claim: Only hundreds, not thousands, of people have died of Covid without any other pre-existing condition mentioned on their death certificate.
review: Incorrect. There were 15,883 deaths recorded with no pre-existing condition in England and Wales alone, up to the end of March 2021.

claim: Does a video implying that five JetBlue pilots died after COVID-19 vaccinations show evidence to back that up?
review: Does a video implying that five JetBlue pilots died after COVID-19 vaccinations show evidence to back that up?

claim: The average age of Covid-19 deaths is higher than the average life expectancy, which means that people who get Covid live longer.
claimant: Alleged messages from Boris Johnson reported by BBC
review: This isn’t how life expectancy works. Life expectancy is an average, pulled down by people who die young. As you age, your life expectancy increases. People dying from Covid-19 lose about a decade of life on average.

claim: The number of Covid hospitalisations is 0.5% of the level of cases.
review: The statistics used to make this claim compare positive test results when tests were first taken versus current hospitalisation figures. Because of the time it may take for symptoms to develop before hospitalisation, this is a flawed calculation.

claimant: Dan Bongino, Alan Jones, Craig Kelly
review: There is no evidence that the Delta variant of SARS-CoV-2 has a lower fatality rate than the wild-type virus

claim: The Covid-19 vaccines are in trials and are all experiments ending in 2023.
review: The Covid-19 vaccine trials have been published in peer-reviewed journals, but data collection is ongoing to allow several years of follow-up on patients.

claim: Four pharmaceutical companies have questionable track records that suggest their COVID-19 vaccines aren’t safe.

claim: Videos show tap water testing positive for COVID-19.
claimant: Posts on Facebook, Twitter, YouTube and BitChute
review: COVID-19 Test Kits Are Not Meant To Be Used With Water

claim: The COVID-19 vaccine contains electromagnetic implants, components, chips that makes the body become magnetic.
review: The clam that the COVID-19 vaccine contains electromagnetic implants, components, chips that makes the body become magnetic is FALSE. There is empirical evidence that the vaccine contains electromagnetic components.

claim: 1,295 people died as a result of the Covid-19 vaccine.
review: That’s how many people reportedly died shortly after vaccination up to 2 June, not necessarily because of the vaccine. Because so many people are being vaccinated, we would expect some of them to die afterwards, by chance.

claim: The spike protein in some Covid-19 vaccines is toxic to humans.
review: There’s some evidence that the spike protein generated by vaccines may travel from the injection site, but we don’t have evidence that it’s harmful.

claim: There were 922,000 adverse reactions as a result of the Covid-19 vaccines and it’s now closer to a million.
review: These are reported reactions as of 2 June. We don’t know that they happened because of the vaccine, just that they happened shortly afterwards.

claim: Ugandan President Yoweri Museveni was "airlifted to Germany" after contracting COVID-19
review: FACT CHECK: Was Ugandan President Yoweri Museveni ‘Airlifted To Germany’?

claim: Some reports suggest Covid-19 vaccines have caused a 2,000% increase in miscarriages.
review: There’s no evidence miscarriages are being caused by the vaccine. You would expect the number of miscarriages following vaccination to increase as more younger people of childbearing age, a proportion of whom may have a miscarriage, become eligible to get vaccinated.

claim: The delta variant of the coronavirus “is approximately 19 times less deadly.”

claim: India's Ministry of Health spokesman died after Covid-19 vaccination

claim: Covid-19 mRNA vaccines cause people to become “magnetic” because of a process called “magnetofection”

claim: Up until 26 May 2021 there have been 888,196 adverse reactions to Covid-19 vaccines and 1,253 deaths where doctors have acknowledged that it is caused by the jab.
review:
These are the numbers of potential adverse reactions and deaths that happened around the time of vaccination, as reported by clinicians and members of the public to the MHRA Yellow Card scheme. 

This does not necessarily mean the vaccine caused that reaction or event.

claim: UP nurse injecting empty syringe to COVID vaccine beneficiary

claim: Covid-19 has never been isolated in a laboratory. It has never been proven to exist.

claim: The Covid-19 vaccines are a mass clinical trial and won’t get to phase 3 trials until 2023.
review: The three Covid-19 vaccines currently in use in the UK have been through many stages of clinical trial and had phase 3 trial data published in peer reviewed journals. The phase 3 trials include long-term follow-up and have completion dates set for 2022 and 2023.

claim: Three British Airways pilots have died of the Covid-19 vaccine in the last seven days.

claim: Covid-19 has a survival rate of 99.8%.
review: This is not true. About 0.23% of the entire UK population has already died with Covid-19.

claim: 97% of positive PCR tests for the Covid-19 virus are false.
review: Theoretically, this could happen at a time of extremely low prevalence, but is not true overall.

claim: Covid-19 death statistics have been manipulated.
review: It is true that deaths shortly after a positive test may include some people who died for other reasons. However, it also does not include people who did die of Covid later on. Information from death certificates reliably shows that, so far, there have been 152,397 fatalities where Covid-19 was mentioned as a cause of death on the death certificate.

claim: Claims footballer from Denmark Christian Eriksen's collapse at the Euros was linked to Covid-19.
review: It is incorrect to claim that Eriksen had received any Covid 19 vaccine prior to his collapse during Denmark’s match against Finland. Inter Milan officials have confirmed he had not been vaccinated and Denmark’s team doctor confirmed that the footballer suffered a cardiac arrest. Due to his age and health profile Eriksen would not have been eligible for a vaccine in either Italy or Denmark prior to the game. The original source of the claim has since confirmed he does not have evidence to back it up.

claim: Asymptomatic transmission of Covid-19 is a hoax.
review: This is untrue. While studies have shown a wide range of results on how common asymptomatic transmission is, there is clear evidence that it has contributed significantly to the spread of the virus.

There is also evidence that the spike protein on the actual virus can damage cells that line blood vessels.  However, the two different spike proteins behave very differently in the body, and so the assumption that spike proteins generated by the vaccine could also harm cells in the bloodstream is unevidenced.

Though the vaccination schedule in Nigeria is in phases with a specific target group at each phase, dissemination of the right information to correct the wrong impression against the COVID 19 vaccine has not been as emphatic as expected. The vaccine requires wider acceptance and coverage to meet the desired objective.

claim: The Covid-19 vaccines have been authorised on an emergency licence, because they are still in clinical trials.
review:
Two of the vaccines have received temporary authorisation, and the Moderna vaccine has been issued conditional marketing authorisation.

These classifications are regulatory tools to allow approval at the earliest time possible during an emergency situation, as soon as there is robust data to show that the benefits outweigh the risks.

claim: The Covid-19 vaccine was only tested on completely healthy people.

Both the Department of Health and Social Care and the WHO have said there is not sufficient evidence to prove the efficacy of Ivermectin as a cure for Covid-19, and its use remains controversial.

In either case both are intended to ensure drug safety, and reports of adverse events are not necessarily linked to the Covid-19 vaccines.

In November 2020 it was reported that GenPact, a professional services firm, had been awarded a £1.5m contract to build an AI tool that could process “the expected high volume” of reports of adverse reactions occurring after, though not necessarily caused by,  Covid-19 vaccination.

claim: Covid-19 vaccines have the capacity to change your DNA.

The antigen is then recognised by the immune system which produces antibodies to fight the real thing.

claim: All animals used in Covid-19 vaccine trials died months later from immune disorders, sepsis and/or cardiac failure.
review: There is no evidence for this.. The claim is based on a 2012 study looking at different vaccines. The animals, in this case mice, were euthanized as is standard procedure in this sort of trial. They did not die “months later” as claimed.
